author: Staff Reporter
text:
Assuring that any complaint pertaining to election process will be looked into promptly, the City Police Commissioner N. Manjunatha appealed to the political parties to avoid making frivolous complaints.

“Such trivial complaints will only waste time and deviate the attention of the authorities from important issues that need to be dealt with during the elections”, he reminded the representatives of political parties.

At the same time, the political party leaders were of the opinion that the police and revenue officials had come late on many occasions when complaints of cash distribution were made on the previous occasions.

Meanwhile, Collector S. Jayandhi had instructed the political parties to refrain from criticising the personal lives of candidates belonging to rival parties.

She also explained about the online facilities available this time for fixing the dates of public meetings during the campaign trail. “The online procedures give more transparency”, she said.

According to her, political parties will be allowed to hold the public meetings only at designated places.

She also said that16,567 names were recommended for removal from the electoral list across the eight Assembly segments in the district either due to double entry or demise of the voter.

Cash seized from businessman returned

Flying squad officials for Tirupur South Assembly constituency on Friday evening seized Rs.18 lakh from a businessman during a vehicle check at Pazhagodown bus stop.

The amount was then taken to the office of Assistant Returning Officer.

After the businessman produced proof for withdrawal of cash from the bank, the amount was released..
title: ‘Do not make frivolous complaints’
